section.para: A CLI tool to generate smart commit messages, code documentation, and more.

listitem.para: Automatically generate documentation for your code
Git hook integration for automatic documentation on commits

section.para: Install from PyPI:

section.title: Usage
section.para: Penify CLI provides several subcommands for different functionalities, organized into basic commands (no login required) and advanced commands (login required).

section.title: Commit
section.para: Generate smart commit messages using local LLM:

Options:
-m, --message: Optional custom commit message
-e, --terminal: Open editor to modify commit message before committing
-d, --description: Generate commit message with both title and description (without this flag, only title is generated)

section.title: Config
section.para: Configure local LLM and JIRA settings:

literallayout.computeroutput:
# Configure LLM settings penify config llm --model MODEL_NAME [--api-base API_URL] [--api-key API_KEY]
# Configure LLM settings through web interface penify config llm-web
# Configure JIRA settings penify config jira --url JIRA_URL --username USERNAME --api-token TOKEN [--verify]
# Configure JIRA settings through web interface penify config jira-web

section.title: Login
section.para: To log in and obtain an API token:
This command will open a browser window for authentication. After successful login, the API key will be saved locally for future use.

section.title: Documentation Generation
section.para: Generate documentation for Git diff, files or folders:

literallayout.computeroutput:
# Generate documentation for latest Git commit diff penify docgen
# Generate documentation for specific file or folder penify docgen -l /path/to/file/or/folder

section.para:
Options:
-l, --location: Path to specific file or folder for documentation generation (defaults to current directory)

section.title: Git Hook Management
section.para: Install or uninstall Git post-commit hooks:

literallayout.computeroutput:
# Install Git hook penify docgen install-hook [-l /path/to/repo]
# Uninstall Git hook penify docgen uninstall-hook [-l /path/to/repo]

section.para:
Options:
-l, --location: Path to the Git repository (defaults to current directory)

section.title: Authentication
section.para: Penify CLI uses an API token for authentication with advanced features.
If no token is available and you try to access an advanced feature, you'll be prompted to log in.

section.title: Local LLM Configuration
section.para: For commit message generation, Penify can use a local LLM. Configure it using:

literallayout.computeroutput: penify config llm --model MODEL_NAME --api-base API_URL --api-key API_KEY

section.para:
Common configurations:
OpenAI: --model gpt-3.5-turbo --api-base https://api.openai.com/v1 --api-key YOUR_KEY
Anthropic: --model claude-2 --api-base https://api.anthropic.com --api-key YOUR_KEY

section.title: JIRA Integration
section.para: Configure JIRA integration to enhance commit messages with issue details:

literallayout.computeroutput: penify config jira --url https://your-domain.atlassian.net --username your-email@example.com --api-token YOUR_API_TOKEN
